activAnalyzer

Source: vignettes/activAnalyzer.Rmd
activAnalyzer.Rmd

The activAnalyzer package was primarily built for working through a shiny app. How using the app is explained in the related user’s guide. The functions used in this app can also be used to analyze data outside the app, as shown below.

Loading packages

library(activAnalyzer)
library(magrittr)
library(ggplot2)

Getting file

file <- system.file("extdata", "acc.agd", package = "activAnalyzer")

Getting results

mydata <-
  prepare_dataset(data = file, epoch_len_out = 60, col_time_stamp = "timestamp") %>%
  mark_wear_time() 

results <-
  mydata %>%
  mark_intensity( equation = "Sasaki et al. (2011) [Adults]", sex = "male") %>%
  recap_by_day(col_date = "date",  sex = "male") %>%
  average_results()

results
#> # A tibble: 1 × 19
#>   valid_days wear_time total_counts_axis1 total_counts_vm total_steps
#>        <int>     <dbl>              <dbl>           <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1          5      768.            513109.         951483.       14869
#> # … with 14 more variables: total_kcal_wear_time <dbl>, minutes_SED <dbl>,
#> #   minutes_LPA <dbl>, minutes_MPA <dbl>, minutes_VPA <dbl>,
#> #   minutes_MVPA <dbl>, percent_SED <dbl>, percent_LPA <dbl>,
#> #   percent_MPA <dbl>, percent_VPA <dbl>, percent_MVPA <dbl>,
#> #   mets_hours_mvpa <dbl>, ratio_mvpa_sed <dbl>, pal <dbl>

Plotting data

plot_data(data = mydata, metric = "steps") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1, vjust = 1))
